docs.lead_paragraph: Wade Boggs lost his bid today for a $1.85 million salary in his fifth year in the major leagues. Tom Roberts, a Los Angeles arbitrator, who heard the case Friday in New York, awarded Boggs the $1.35 million salary the Boston Red Sox sought for the American League batting champion.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Nov. 7 (AP) An American League vote on the proposed sale of the Boston Red Sox was postponed indefinitely today because of a pending court suit by an Ohio-based conglomerate that wants to buy the baseball team.
docs.abstract: AL vote on proposed sale of team is postponed indefinitely because of pending ct suit by A-T-O Inc, Ohio-based conglomerate that wants to buy team (S)

headline.main: American League's Vote On Red Sox Sale Put Off

docs.lead_paragraph: WITH only seven shopping days left before Christmas, some baseball players are getting restive. Their ever-loving helpmeets expect to find a swatch of sable or a star sapphire under the tree on Christmas morning, but the World Series paychecks that were to have provided these trinkets have not arrived. Some noses could be out of joint.
docs.abstract: Red Smith on outlook for talks between owners and Players Assn (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The slugger who helped lift the cloud over the Red Sox is still crushing homers at age 40. But his remarkable season is a definitive goodbye.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pablo Sandoval is headed to Boston, bumping Hanley Ramirez to an already crowded outfield and opening an array of options for a team trying to rebuilding its starting rotation.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes Boston Red Sox deals for third baseman Pablo Sandoval and Hanley Ramirez, set to play in outfield, open up array of options and possibilities, as team seeks to rebuild its starting rotation and take another run at a championship.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rusney Castillo, 27, agreed to a deal with Boston, joining Yoenis Cespedes, another outfielder from Cuba who joined the Red Sox less than a month ago.
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Boston Red Sox reach seven year, $72.5 million contract with outfielder Rusney Castillo, in what will be richest contract ever for a Cuban defector; other baseball news noted.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of veterans chopped from the roster of the World Series champion Boston Red Sox is staggering.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that Boston Red Sox have traded a staggering number of veterans from their 2013 World Series champion roster; holds that losses make it more likely that team will finish in or near last place, only one season after winning the championship.
docs.snippet: The number of veterans chopped from the roster of the World Series champion Boston Red Sox is staggering....

headline.main: Trade Winds Scatter a Roster of Champions
headline.print_headline: Trade Winds Scatter a Roster of Champions

docs.lead_paragraph: The Hall of Famer Ted Williams was released today from Shands Hospital, where he was admitted last Thursday with flulike symptoms, including a high fever and low blood pressure. Williams, 83, returned with relatives to his Florida home, the hospital said in a statement. He will continue to require daily at-home kidney dialysis treatment.
docs.abstract: Hall of Fame baseball player Ted Williams is released from hospital after being treated for flulike symptoms (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: This off-season, the Red Sox added players who could improve the clubhouse culture from the toxic atmosphere that had permeated it since the September 2011 collapse.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Red Sox are over .500 without three starting pitchers, their closer, their left fielder, their center fielder, their second baseman, a backup outfielder and two setup men.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that the Boston Red Sox have been hammered by injuries, but are still over .500 and pressing on.
